attributes.action: require councils to offer, & give first refusal, any & asset sell off to the council community.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Far too many councils and therefore central government should not wish to be seen to be making clandestine deals with developers over asset sales.

This simple petition will: i) give the public their chance to maintain their own community ii) prevent the public from criticising their councils & iii) discourage the council & their representatives from carrying out borderline fraudulent financial deals.

For example, the L.B. of Richmond Council (who sold 66 sites in 2007 and purchased 4) have been seen to have made several suspicious asset sale deals over the last few years, including the current sale of Twickenham Riverside for an extremely low £4m for development of private residences despite earlier the council promises of new amenity complex. Resident groups wishing to purchase the site for themselves have been refused. Such examples are nationwide.
